intro: Boerhavia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Somalia and Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, which help it conserve water in arid environments. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Boerhavia somalensis is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
